intro: Bulbostylis puberula var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its compact stature and narrow leaves. The plant produces tiny, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, white or pale green flowers. It typically grows in wet, marshy habitats and is often found in low-lying areas with poor drainage. Due to its delicate appearance and specific ecological requirements, it is a relatively rare and less commonly cultivated species.
